definition: a common occurrence (idiom)
surname Si
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
accustomed to/used to/indulge/to spoil (a child)

sentences.english: The New York magazine is no stranger to controversial covers.
sentences.chinese: 紐約雜誌對爭議性封面司空見慣。

sentences.english: Gratuity is customary in this money-mad metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 在這個金錢至上的都市裏，給小費是司空見慣的。

sentences.english: Gratuity is customary in this money-mad  metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 在這個金錢至上的大都市裏，給小費是司空見慣的。

sentences.english: Job-hopping is a very common thing.
sentences.chinese: 眺槽是一件司空見慣的事。

sentences.english: Kenworth trucks are a common sight on major highways and interstates.
sentences.chinese: 肯沃斯卡車是對主要公路和州際公路司空見慣。

sentences.english: These are services we're used to on the PC.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是在電腦上已經司空見慣的服務。

sentences.english: Pirating used to be commonplace in this country.
sentences.chinese: 在這個國家，非法翻印曾經是司空見慣的。

sentences.english: Such scenes could become more common sights in the UK. Photograph: Peter Macdiarmid/Getty Images
sentences.chinese: 如此場面可能會在英國變得司空見慣。

sentences.english: "occupies the place" is in the university campus the commonly seen phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: “佔座”是大學校園裏司空見慣的現象。

sentences.english: Rebounds to the family are common between the ages of 18 to 22.
sentences.chinese: 在18至22之間又返回家庭這一現司空見慣。

sentences.english: This is not unusual for a small, family-run business.
sentences.chinese: 在家族企業裏，這種現象是司空見慣了的。

sentences.english: In fact, it is not uncommon for a complete circular rainbow to be seen from an airplane.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，從飛機上看完整的圓虹霓是司空見慣的。

sentences.english: Passing the buck is a way of life in large bureaucracies.
sentences.chinese: 推卸責任是大官僚機構裏司空見慣的事。

sentences.english: Nowadays there is nothing strange in a youngster writing verses.
sentences.chinese: 現在年青人寫詩已是司空見慣。

sentences.english: The girls mill around. They are used to her tears by now.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在繞圈圈，她們對太婆流淚已司空見慣。

sentences.english: The detailed package inserts supplied with medicines have long been a familiar feature of pharmaceuticals.
sentences.chinese: 隨藥品附送的詳細包裝插頁更是司空見慣。

definition: accustomed to/used to
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
a common occurrence (idiom)
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
in great abundance/numerous
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to sweep clean/to clean out
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
bitter/harsh/grim/ruthless/severe/cut-throat (competition)
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
circumstances
to turn a blind eye to
